author: Alexander Smart
title: Glow Formal verification
description: Catastrophic bugs keep developers from wanting to build DApps, because the risk of losing all the assets in the DApp is terrifying.

assessments.note: Strong team and understanding of the problem is obvious.  Complex problems require complex solutions and this verification system should help developers build on this platform and trust the correctness of their code.
This could provide a strong guarantee for DApps built on the Cardano blockchain

The success of DApps in Cardano depends on their ability to produce verifiable applications. Glow is being seen as a multi-blockchain language with support for Cardano. There is a need to have a toolkit for formal verification of dAPPs utilizing smart contracts. This will be a certifiable daapps if this proposal becomes successful.

$60,000 in the first 3 months for a proof of concept seems steep. I would prefer to see that initial amount last longer before additional funding is required. If it is fast and cheap it can't be good (Iron Triangle). Maybe a solution that has a longer development window would give this a better chance of successful implementation.
The proposers have the skills. It is possible it still fails though as they have to solve this problem on the Cardano blockchain.
The proposers are authors of a full-fledged multi-blockchain language. It is almost certain that they will produce a prototype within the time period they had set.
Very well documented and researched proposal. I am very impressed with the presentation and team compiled. Answers all questions from a development perspective.
This is a detailed plan to expand a product the proposers already have onto DApps on the Cardano blockchain. This could make DApps safer and more likely to be produced.
The project is open source and the community will have access to the progress. The progress has clear benchmarks and it is montitorable.

solution: MuKn's Glow language will overcome this problem by automatically proving the mathematical correctness of every interaction of a program.
experience: MuKn built the Glow language, and our CEO was one of the first to formally verify the correctness of a payment system that held up in court.
